intro: Ilex kunthiana, commonly known as the Evergreen holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Aquifoliaceae. It is native to the southwestern United States, particularly in Arizona and New Mexico, and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its dense, spiny foliage and small, dark green leaves that remain on the plant year-round. It produces red berries that are an important food source for birds and other wildlife. Ilex kunthiana is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in challenging conditions.
